programme.title: Roots: Annika Sorenstam
programme.desc: Chart the rise of Annika Sorenstam - a 10-time Major champion with 72 LPGA victories - by hearing from those who know her best, including family, friends, coaches and the Swede herself.

programme.title: The Memorial Tournament 2014 Hlts
programme.desc: The Memorial Tournament from Muirfield Village Golf Club in Dublin, Ohio. Matt Kuchar claimed a two-stroke victory over fellow American Kevin Chappell last time out.

programme.desc: Action from day four of the 79th US Women's Open in Pennsylvania. 2022 winner Minjee Lee held a share of the lead at five-under going into the final round after a strong third day. (02.06)

programme.title: McEnroe v Borg 1980
programme.desc: With the French Open and Wimbledon secured, Bjorn Borg met defending champion John McEnroe in the men's singles final at the 1980 US Open. Borg was bidding for his first US Open title.

programme.title: ATP Final: Dubai
programme.desc: A men's singles champion is crowned in the final of the Dubai Duty Free Tennis Championships, an ATP Tour 500 event in the United Arab Emirates. (01.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Dubai
programme.desc: A women's singles champion is crowned in Dubai. Russia's Mirra Andreeva - the youngest-ever WTA finalist - and Denmark's Clara Tauson face off for glory. (22.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Montpellier
programme.desc: In his 17th career final and second of 2025, Felix Auger-Aliassime takes on American qualifier Aleksandar Kovacevic, who stunned top seed Andrey Rublev, for the Montpellier crown. (02.02)

programme.title: WTA Final: Singapore
programme.desc: At the Singapore Open, Elise Mertens competes in her second final of the season as the 29-year-old Belgian faces the United States' Ann Li, who seeks her second WTA singles title. (02.02)

programme.title: Venus v Davenport 2000
programme.desc: The 2000 US Open women's singles final saw an all-American affair, as Venus Williams, making her fourth appearance here, met the world number one, Lindsay Davenport.

programme.title: ATP Final: Indian Wells
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper competes in his maiden ATP Masters 1000 final at Indian Wells as the top-10 bound Brit faces Holger Rune. Draper knocked out Carlos Alcaraz in the last four. (16.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Indian Wells
programme.desc: Mirra Andreeva meets top seed Aryna Sabalenka in the Indian Wells final. Sabalenka avenged her Australian Open defeat to Keys in the semis, while Andreeva dethroned Swiatek. (16.03)

programme.desc: Step behind the scenes of men's professional tennis throughout the 2025 season on the ATP Tour with special features, interviews and much more.

programme.title: WTA Miami 2025 Review
programme.desc: A review of the 2025 Miami Open, a WTA 1000 event.

programme.title: WTA Final: Transylvania
programme.desc: A third career singles title is the target for Anastasia Potapova, as the world number 32 takes on unseeded Italian Lucia Bronzetti in the final of the Transylvania Open in Cluj. (09.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Buenos Aires
programme.desc: Joao Fonseca's soaring career hits new heights, as the 18-year-old becomes the youngest ATP clay finalist since Carlos Alcaraz when he faces Francisco Cerundolo in Buenos Aires. (16.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Rotterdam
programme.desc: Carlos Alcaraz attempts to cap his debut at the ABN AMRO Open in Rotterdam with a 17th tour-level title, as the top seed squares off against world number six Alex de Minaur. (09.02)

programme.title: WTA Final: Abu Dhabi
programme.desc: 2021 Olympic gold medallist Belinda Bencic looks to capture her first title since returning from maternity leave, as the Swiss star faces Ashlyn Krueger in the Abu Dhabi final. (08.02)

programme.title: Venus v Serena 2001

programme.desc: Chasing a record seventh men's Miami crown, Novak Djokovic - now the oldest ATP Masters 1000 finalist - takes on Jakub Mensik, aiming to win his first tour-level trophy. (30.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Miami
programme.desc: In Miami, the women's final get underway as top seed Aryna Sabalenka meets with home favourite Jessica Pegula in a repeat of last year's US Open decider. (29.03)

programme.desc: After upsetting top seed Daniil Medvedev in the semi-finals, Hamad Medjedovic targets the Open 13 Provence title as the 21-year-old Serb meets reigning champion Ugo Humbert. (16.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Delray Beach
programme.desc: A first tour-level title is within reach for Alejandro Davidovich Fokina, as the Spaniard looks to overcome seventh seed Miomir Kecmanovic of Serbia in the Delray Beach Open final. (16.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Hamburg
programme.desc: Andrey Rublev appears in his third Hamburg Open final, as the former champion seeks his 351st tour-level victory and a second title here against Italy's Flavio Cobolli. (24.05)

programme.title: WTA Final: Rabat
programme.desc: Maya Joint targets her first WTA Tour singles title as the Australian teenager, who also claimed victory in the Rabat doubles, comes up against unseeded Romanian Jaqueline Cristian. (24.05)

programme.title: ATP Final: Geneva
programme.desc: A chance for Novak Djokovic to join Jimmy Connors and Roger Federer in winning a 100th tour-level title, as the 38-year-old Serb battles Hubert Hurkacz in the Geneva Open final. (24.05)
